Parameter | Condition | Description
tenant | Required | Can be /common, /consumers, or /organizations. It can also be the directory tenant that you want to request permission from in GUID or friendly name format.

replies.bodyText:
Tested in authorization step, supplying "common" in place of the tenant ID return "invalid_request".


What is the exact error message that you're getting? Does it have something to do with single tenant/multiple tenant applications? /common is not supported if your device is marked as a single tenant application.


 Even if it worked, wouldn't we run into the same issue where we would have to parse out the tenant id in order to just get /common in the endpoint?


This is what I've been saying that this is a bug. It doesn't make sense to be to have /common append after tenantID in the first place - more so if it's /common after /common - and we should be fixing the problem at the root cause (why /common was appended, and if it's justified.)
